channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Outside no.37a, 18th November
item.description:
Pavement slab is not flat, bad trip hazard. Step on one corner the other side lifts up and vice versa.

item.title: Camberwell road, Walworth road , Farmers road, Wyndham road pavements every 4 m dumped blue bags, has not been colected from weekend, 18th November
item.description:
Why are you not cleaning streets ? Where are cars for s cleaning streets like anothers borough in London ? Can you start use them and do it deep cleaning of pavements and roads?

item.title: Abandoned Vehicle, 18th November
item.description:
I reported this back in April 2025 via FixMyStreet and nothing has happened, it has not moved since that time. It is taking up a free parking space that others could be using.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southwood Road, Eltham

item.title: Goalposts removed - Hoblingwell, 18th November
item.description:
The football goalposts on the northern side of the upper terrace at Hoblingwell Wood Recreation Ground have been removed. They are currently lying on the rugby pitch on the middle terrace. The post sockets were left open, presenting a hazard. These have been closed but are not locked. Metal pegs were also found in the vicinity, which also present a hazard to park users. Please could this be rectified?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Petersham Drive, St Paul's Cray, Orpington, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-9, Seymour Street, Marylebone, City of Westminster

item.description:

item.title: Street lights not working, 18th November
item.description:
Half of the streetlights on Lee High Road appear to be non-functioning in the dark, particularly from Manor Park to Lenham Road. This is a safety hazard as pedestrians crossing the road can be almost invisible due to being completely unlit
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Halley Gardens, Hither Green, Lee, London Borough of Lewisham

item.category: All out - three or more street lights in a row
